overview_of_class:
Development of critical reading and writing skills, literary and historical analysis, philosophy, art history, epigraphy, papyrology, numismatics, and textual criticism. The focus for Spring 2016 is Athens 508-462 BC: the first two generations of the democracy. Readings include Aeschylus' Persians and Suppliant Women.

Required for the major. Pre-requisite: junior or senior standing.
name: Research Seminar
subject: CLASSICS
